intro: Sebestena scabra, commonly known as the rough sebestena, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough stems and palmately lobed leaves. Its showy yellow flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round, yellowish fruits. Sebestena scabra is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
